title: No android support?
comment: Nuff said

title: Would be great if..
comment: ..if it would have ,,Only this event,, delete option. As if you create an event which repeats lets say every week, in case you want to delete just past event this calendar does not let you do so. It will let you delete ,,all events,, or ,,all future events,,. Apart from that brilliant app. Do not worry about the above problem if you do not mind keeping past events in your calendar.
The mentioned bug is inside Android's calendar app, so I cannot fix it. See https://github.com/dschuermann/offline-calendar/issues/15

title: Doesn't work
comment: Can't import a calendar........ Says it can't find iCal Import/Export (in Play Store).... So what's it for????

title: Could be better
comment: If it had is own separate database and back up to SD. With these features I would be super happy

title: junk app
comment: the title is "offline calander" you download it and it says no calendars avail.... garbage app
Fukin stu

title: Awesome
comment: Perfect when Google account sync just doesn't work with Calendars or when you don't care about syncing any events to Google. Stupid Google requires you to add an online account to even be able to use the calendar app. Take this Google!

title: Lacks the actual calendar
comment: You can create "calendars" and set a name and colour.  But unless the you have another calendar, namely the old and no longer supported "Calendar" app, you can't actually use them.  Useless.

title: Great app, backup!
comment: This is a really useful app, thanks! Be sure to backup your phone regularly including this app, one day without explanation I lost my entire calendar!
This is not calender

title: None of that stupid sync rubbish!
comment: So nice to find a way to avoid all that gmail interference and spying. I'm very happy to not back up, not sync and not make public my calendar. Great!

title: What I needed
comment: Thank u very much   U r a genius

title: LOVE this
comment: I had been looking for an offline calendar. I'm tired of Google being all up in my business. This is helping me TREMENDOUSLY! Thank you so much!

title: Exactly what I needed!
comment: I now have calendars for my family members and subcategories for myself to see what's happening at a glance by the color coding. Integrated with native calendar app so I didn't need another one, perfect.

title: No Backup Support=Waste of time.
comment: I can't understand why the dev wouldn't have added something so obvious as a way to backup and restore calendar events to this point. It's great that your calendar is offline but I've never met anyone who hasn't had to do a factory reset and/or bought a new phone. So, as is, you lose all your offline calendar events. Waste of time unless you have root, which most people don't or in my case, can't.
Win bisschen irrefuehrend fuer neulinge... Dachte erst es waere ein offline calendar. Nein. Es ist ein fake account erzeuger. Nuetzlich!

title: Worst calender
comment: It didn't work.totally a scrap....thank god it occupies a tiny space. But I delete it.

title: Useless
comment: Is this for iPhone only?  I can create a calendar and choose a color but nothing else. Promise I pushed every button possible

title: Nexus 5
comment: Love it! I now color code my events. Very easy to use and fast input. Just what you need to never forget anything again!

title: This is not a calender.
comment: Its an add on for the existing crappy android calender. Has no instructions and is hard to use. Does not seem to offer any features. You can get exactly the same offline effect by simply not syncing your android calender in account settings.  This app offers no alternative to the stock OS calender and is had to use with no instructions. No alarms, and as I mentioned. No actual calender to use if android calender is disabled/removed

The description clearly states the app's purpose. Maybe the name is not perfect, what would you suggest as an app name instead of "Offline Calendar"?
Most of your other statements are not true, but it would be a waste of time to explain here why.

title: Great Job !
comment: Thanks for this nice and useful App. Love it to don't have to sync my private data to Google. @ Arabia D: This is a free app without Ads. Pay for a function you would like to have and you will get it.
Finally. An app that doesn't want to use my video/audio. Thank you!

title: Perfect
comment: Works well in jb and kk.
Good app and good created cal databases

title: Worst, including its developer.
comment: Most stupid thing I ever saw. Upon starting, It complains - "No offline calender! Add one!" So I tried to add one. But it never let's u add any. I remembered now I tried this last year also.  U r again proving u r actually the stupidest 'developer' by thinking I didn't try ur stupid buttons. I am a senior IT Professional for 17+ years, and interface design is 1 of my areas. I never saw such stupid, unfriendly interface.
Most stupid user I ever saw. He wasn't able to click on the "+" button inside the menu.

title: Needs Native Import/Export
comment: It's a nice app to keep offline calendars but the import/export feature is not native within the app

title: Essential
comment: Could not do without this. I don't want to have my calendar info synced to anywhere. Would not use Google Calendar without it.

Click on a calendar, open the overflow menu, delete.
Offline Calendars never sync.

title: Perfect!
comment: Now I no longer need to share my data with the almighty Google servers.
now I can create plenty calendars for different uses all show up under one UI without tied to the google email account, the old calendar becomes categorised diary, all color coded, great!
Provides functionality which should be default

comment: Thus app is so clutch. I hate having to sync stuff to google just because they want me to. No I own my data and information.

title: Open source yay!
comment: It's really stupid that the AOSP Calendar makes you sync with an Account inorder to use it. This app is a so important if you want to use the calendar offline.

title: Essential

title: SAMSUNG GRAND
comment: Great App...

title: Perfect! The perfect solution
comment: Ifbyou say anything negative about this app, you don't understand what it does.  Creates a separate calendar with your color choices that can be accessed by a variety of standard calendar programs. Works perfectly. I would like some encryption as an enhancement. I have not tried encrpting the program. Always wanted an expanding appt list widget that was pin protected. Maybe someday. Thanks for this and great job in implenting the best solution.

title: A must have
comment: This really makes a fully offline calendar for the ones who are looking for this. Such calendar created is reachable then from any other regular calendar client.  Great job! Thanks!

title: Doesn't work
comment: Doesn't work at all in Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini i8190. Blank screen then crashes. Never saw anything of the software. But nice try and thanks for the effort.
